revised_title: Analysis of Rowleyrag-Stone and Toad-Stone: Mineral Substances from Staffordshire
tldr: The author, William Withering, examines two mineral substances, Rowleyrag-Stone and Toad-Stone, found in Staffordshire. Through a series of experiments and chemical analysis, he determines that Rowleyrag-Stone consists of siliceous earth, clay, calciform iron, and alum earth, while Toad-Stone contains a mix of siliceous earth, clay, and calcareous matter.
